head.title: Astros' Swindell May Cross That Line

hedline.hl1: Astros' Swindell May Cross That Line

block.p: Houston Astros pitcher GREG SWINDELL is considering breaking ranks with other major leaguers if the baseball strike isn't resolved before spring training.

"I have very few friends in baseball right now that I'm close and personal with, anyway," Swindell told a television station, KRIV in Houston. "If the time comes and things happen, they can think what they want."
Houston Astros pitcher GREG SWINDELL is considering breaking ranks with other major leaguers if the baseball strike isn't resolved before spring training.

"I have very few friends in baseball right now that I'm close and personal with, anyway," Swindell told a television station, KRIV in Houston. "If the time comes and things happen, they can think what they want."
Swindell added: "I've got house payments, I've got ex-wife payments, I've got a 5-year-old, a 3-year-old and a 7-week-old. It's going to be a tough decision. We'll make it when the time comes."
Swindell was 8-9 last season with a 4.37 earned run average. He's set to make $4.2 million in 1995 and $5.3 million in 1996. (AP) SPORTS PEOPLE: BASEBALL
